column4: if I leave my hoary laptop for a cpl hours, will ubuntu try and put it into hibernate mode?
does ubuntu try to use hibernate mode after a couple of hours?
cause my laptop keeps cutting out during the night
if I try hibernate mode from the log out screen in gnome, I just get a screensaver
so perhaps thats not the problem
hmm.. interesting. what problems were you having?
/proc/acpi/battery/BAT0/state was being misreported. i needed to patch acpi support in the kernel to fix it.
I see. was your machine randomly powering off too?
I also did have a problem the other day where state said there was no battery present O_o
if i were you i'd grep the debian-laptop-list for clues. nearly every issue ever encountered is therein
